QuestionText: Which of the following sentences is in the active voice?
OptionA: The ball was thrown by John.
OptionB: The new employee was given the task.
OptionC: The manager is writing the report.
OptionD: The play was performed by the students.
CorrectAnswer: The manager is writing the report.

QuestionText: Which of the following sentences uses the subjunctive mood correctly?
OptionA: I suggest that he takes a break.
OptionB: It is required that she be present.
OptionC: I propose that they go to the movies.
OptionD: The manager demands that the employee works harder.
CorrectAnswer: It is required that she be present.

QuestionText: Which of the following is an example of a misplaced modifier?
OptionA: Having studied all night, the exam was easy.
OptionB: The teacher gave the student a book that was written by her.
OptionC: The new policy has been met with resistance from the employees who are worried about their jobs.
OptionD: The company will hire someone who is experienced and skilled.
CorrectAnswer: Having studied all night, the exam was easy.

QuestionText: Which of the following sentences uses the present perfect tense correctly?
OptionA: I have never been to Europe, but I went last year.
OptionB: She has lived in Paris for three years.
OptionC: They have been married for 20 years.
CorrectAnswer: She has lived in Paris for three years.

QuestionText: Which of the following sentences uses the verb 'to lie' correctly?
OptionA: The dog lays on the bed.
OptionB: The books lie on the table.
OptionC: She lies on the couch to take a nap.
OptionD: The manager laid off several employees.
CorrectAnswer: The books lie on the table.

QuestionText: Which of the following is an example of a noun clause?
OptionA: That the company is profitable is well-known.
OptionB: The new policy is that employees must wear uniforms.
OptionC: The fact that the employee was late was not a problem.
OptionD: The manager asked the employee why he was late.
CorrectAnswer: That the company is profitable is well-known.

QuestionText: Which of the following sentences uses the passive voice correctly?
OptionA: The new policy was announced by the manager.
OptionB: The students are writing the report.
OptionC: The play was performed by the students.
OptionD: The company will hire someone who is experienced.
CorrectAnswer: The new policy was announced by the manager.

QuestionText: Which of the following is an example of a subordinate clause?
OptionA: Because it is raining, the game will be canceled.
OptionB: The manager is writing the report now.
OptionC: The employee was given the task to finish by the end of the day.
OptionD: The company will hire someone who is experienced.
CorrectAnswer: Because it is raining, the game will be canceled.

QuestionText: Which of the following sentences uses the infinitive phrase correctly?
OptionA: The manager wants to hire someone who is experienced.
OptionB: She is going to the store to buy milk.
OptionC: The employee is expected to finish the task by the end of the day.
OptionD: The company will hire someone that is skilled.
CorrectAnswer: The manager wants to hire someone who is experienced.

QuestionText: Which of the following is an example of a phrase fragment?
OptionA: The new employee will be given the task to finish by the end of the day.
OptionC: The manager is writing the report now.
OptionD: The company will hire someone who is experienced.
